description: This metadata schema includes general metadata elements for research software.
title: CodeMeta

name.description: The name of the item (software, Organization)
name.title: name

identifier.description: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing, such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links. See background notes for more details.
identifier.title: identifier

keywords.description: Keywords or tags used to describe this content. Multiple entries in a keywords list are typically delimited by commas.
keywords.title: keywords

developmentStatus.description: Description of development status, e.g. Active, inactive, suspended. See repostatus.org
developmentStatus.title: developmentStatus

issueTracker.description: Link to software bug reporting or issue tracking system
issueTracker.title: issueTracker

referencePublication.description: Any academic publication which describes the software.
referencePublication.title: referencePublication

license.description: A license document that applies to this content, typically indicated by URL.
license.title: license

copyrightHolder.description: The party holding the legal copyright to the CreativeWork.
copyrightHolder.title: copyrightHolder

isAccessibleForFree.description: A flag to signal that the publication is accessible for free.
isAccessibleForFree.title: isAccessibleForFree

dateCreated.description: The date on which the CreativeWork was created or the item was added to a DataFeed.
dateCreated.title: dateCreated

dateModified.description: The date on which the CreativeWork was most recently modified or when the item's entry was modified within a DataFeed.
dateModified.title: dateModified

contributor.description: A secondary contributor to the CreativeWork or Event.
contributor.title: contributor

author.description: The author of this content or rating. Please note that author is special in that HTML 5 provides a special mechanism for indicating authorship via the rel tag. That is equivalent to this and may be used interchangeably.
author.title: author

maintainer.description: Individual responsible for maintaining the software.
maintainer.title: maintainer

funding.description: Information on the funding which was used to develop the software.
funding.title: funding

downloadUrl.description: If the file can be downloaded, URL to download the binary.
downloadUrl.title: downloadUrl

codeRepository.description: Link to the repository where the un-compiled, human readable code and related code is located (SVN, GitHub, CodePlex, institutional GitLab instance, etc.).
codeRepository.title: codeRepository

readme.description: Link to the documentation describing the code and is usful for developers.
readme.title: readme

applicationCategory.description: Type of software application, e.g. 'Game, Multimedia'.
applicationCategory.title: applicationCategory

applicationSubCategory.description: Subcategory of the application, e.g. 'Arcade Game'.
applicationSubCategory.title: applicationSubCategory

citation.description: A citation or reference to another creative work, such as another publication, web page, scholarly article, etc.

copyrightYear.description: The year during which the claimed copyright for the CreativeWork was first asserted.
copyrightYear.title: copyrightYear

editor.description: Specifies the Person who edited the CreativeWork.
editor.title: editor

encoding.description: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork. This property is a synonym for associatedMedia. Supersedes encodings.
encoding.title: encoding

fileFormat.description: Media type, typically MIME format (see IANA site) of the content e.g. application/zip of a SoftwareApplication binary. In cases where a CreativeWork has several media type representations, 'encoding' can be used to indicate each MediaObject alongside particular fileFormat information. Unregistered or niche file formats can be indicated instead via the most appropriate URL, e.g. defining Web page or a Wikipedia entry.
fileFormat.title: fileFormat

hasPart.description: Indicates a CreativeWork that is (in some sense) a part of this CreativeWork. Reverse property isPartOf
hasPart.title: hasPart

installUrl.description: URL at which the app may be installed, if different from the URL of the item.
installUrl.title: installUrl

isPartOf.description: Indicates a CreativeWork that this CreativeWork is (in some sense) part of. Reverse property hasPart
isPartOf.title: isPartOf

permissions.description: Permission(s) required to run the app (for example, a mobile app may require full internet access or may run only on wifi).
permissions.title: permissions

position.description: The position of an item in a series or sequence of items. (While schema.org considers this a property of CreativeWork, it is also the way to indicate ordering in any list (e.g. the Authors list). By default arrays are unordered in JSON-LD
position.title: position

producer.description: The person or organization who produced the work (e.g. music album, movie, tv/radio series etc.).
producer.title: producer

provider.description: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller. Supersedes carrier.
provider.title: provider

publisher.description: The publisher of the creative work.
publisher.title: publisher

relatedLink.description: A link related to this object, e.g. related web pages
relatedLink.title: relatedLink

releaseNotes.description: Description of what changed in this version.
releaseNotes.title: releaseNotes

runtimePlatform.description: Runtime platform or script interpreter dependencies (Example - Java v1, Python2.3, .Net Framework 3.0). Supersedes runtime.
runtimePlatform.title: runtimePlatform

sameAs.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Wikidata entry, or official website.
sameAs.title: sameAs

softwareSuggestions.description: Optional dependencies , e.g. for optional features, code development, etc.
softwareSuggestions.title: softwareSuggestions

sponsor.description: A person or organization that supports a thing through a pledge, promise, or financial contribution. e.g. a sponsor of a Medical Study or a corporate sponsor of an event.
sponsor.title: sponsor

targetProduct.description: Target Operating System / Product to which the code applies. If applies to several versions, just the product name can be used.
targetProduct.title: targetProduct

version.description: The version of the CreativeWork embodied by a specified resource.
version.title: version

endDate.description: The end date and time of the item
endDate.title: endDate

startDate.description: The start date and time of the item
startDate.title: startDate

embargoEndDate.description: Software may be embargoed from public access until a specified date (e.g. pending publication, 1 year from publication)
embargoEndDate.title: embargoEndDate

hasSourceCode.description: Link that states where the software code is for a given software. For example a software registry may indicate that one of its software entries hasSourceCode in a GitHub repository.
hasSourceCode.title: hasSourceCode

isSourceCodeOf.description: Link that states where software application is built from a given source code. This is the reverse property of 'hasSourceCode'.
isSourceCodeOf.title: isSourceCodeOf

Organization.description: An organization such as a school, NGO, corporation, club, etc.
Organization.title: Organization

legalName.description: The official name of the organization, e.g. the registered company name.
legalName.title: legalName

identifier.description: URL identifier, ideally a ROR for institutions.
identifier.title: identifier

CreativeWork.description: The most generic kind of creative work, including books, movies, photographs, software programs, etc.
CreativeWork.title: CreativeWork

identifier.description: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing, such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc.
identifier.title: identifier

identifier.description: URL identifier, ideally a DOI for a publication.
identifier.title: identifier

Person.description: A person (alive, dead, undead, or fictional).
Person.title: Person

identifier.description: URL identifier, ideally an ORCID ID for individuals, a FundRef ID for funders.
identifier.title: identifier

givenName.description: Given name. In the U.S., the first name of a Person. This can be used along with familyName instead of the name property.
givenName.title: givenName

familyName.description: Family name. In the U.S., the last name of an Person. This can be used along with givenName instead of the name property.
familyName.title: familyName

affiliation.description: An organization that this person is affiliated with. For example, a school/university
affiliation.title: affiliation
